summary: I am a jack of all trades IT guy at one of the premier intellectual property law schools in the world, whose job description and responsibilities continue to evolve with the ever-changing opportunities that new technology provides. Extremely self-motivated, detail oriented, and organized, I thrive most when presented with opportunities to creatively solve new and interesting challenges.
skills: Microsoft Office for Windows and Mac

experience.title: Information Technology Administrator
experience.company: University of New Hampshire School of Law (formerly Franklin Pierce Law Center)
experience.description: Oversee purchasing, management, and maintenance of infrastructure hardware and software, provide end-user hardware/software support for a law school with ~85 FTE faculty/staff and ~275 students; manage IT budget, service/maintenance contracts, and IT policies; administer a 5-host, 40-server VMware environment, help desk, network monitoring, campus security systems, ID card system, printing, electronic exam system; backup critical data on UNH Law network; manage fileservers, webservers and web applications; design and maintain campus-wide network with Durham and Concord campuses; install and support Windows, Linux, and Mac OS Server platforms.

experience.title: Associate Director of Computer Services
experience.company: University of New Hampshire School of Law (formerly Franklin Pierce Law Center)
experience.description: Directly supported end-user hardware, software, peripherals in mixed Windows/MacOS/Linux/Novell environment; maintained campus-wide network with Cisco infrastructure; backup for Director of Computer Services; designed and implemented campus wireless network; led OS/version upgrades (Windows 98 to XP to 7; Mac OS/iOS upgrades); transitioned e-mail platform from Novell GroupWise to Microsoft Exchange after integration with UNH.

experience.title: District Computer Technician
experience.description: Supported end-user hardware and software demands for the school district; troubleshot daily tasks and implemented new technologies, such as the first Apple Airport WiFi network and roaming iBook lab.

experience.title: Electrician's Apprentice
experience.description: Predominantly industrial electrical work, mostly in a manufacturing setting, with some residential work mixed in.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Exercise and Sports Sciences
